noun.definition: A building or room containing collections of books, periodicals, and sometimes films and recorded music for use or borrowing by the public or the members of an institution.
noun.example: They went to the library to study.

noun.definition: A collection of books and periodicals held in a library.
noun.example: He has a vast library of history books.

verb.definition: To furnish with a library; to place in a library (rare).

usage_examples: I spent the afternoon at the public library.
The software comes with a library of pre-built functions.
